title.narrative: Danish Refugee Council - Mixed Migration Centre - 2019-2020

description.narrative: Danish Refugee Council - Mixed Migration Centre - 2019-2020

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2: DRC collects primary and comparable data on mixed migration along various routes through the 4Mi intiative

- 10,000 interviews with migrants conducted globally - Standardising the survey to ensure cross-regional comparability - Harmonising 4Mi methodology across all regions - Expansion of 4Mi to new regions - Continuous updates and refinements of the 4Mi global data portal

target.value: - 10.000 interviews with migrants conducted globally - Standardising the survey to ensure cross-regional comparability - Harmonising 4Mi methodology across all regions - Expansion of 4Mi to new regions - Continuous updates and refinements of the 4Mi global data portal

title.narrative: 3: Coherent and proactive engagement in global and regional policy processes through provision of expertise to relevant policy debates at national, regional and global levels

- MMC actively participates in global and regional conferences on mixed migration - Publication of 2 policy papers on the follow-up and implementation of the GCM - Organisation of 2 round tables on follow-up and implementation of the GCM - Provision of policy advice (upon request) to the Danish government - Organisation of 2 global 'friends of MMC' meetings to strengthen engagement with donors and partners - Development of qualitative indicators to analyse follow-up and implementation of the GCM on selected objectives / in selected geographies

target.value: - MMC actively participates in global and regional conferences on mixed migration - Publication of 2 policy papers on the follow-up and implementation of the GCM - Organisation of 2 round tables on follow-up and implementation of the GCM - Provision of policy advice (upon request) to the Danish government - Organisation of 2 global 'friends of MMC' meetings to strengthen engagement with donors and partners - Development of qualitative indicators to analyse follow-up and implementation of the GCM on selected objectives / in selected geographies

title.narrative: 1: The MMC global network is further established as the go-to resource for research, analysis and policy engagement on mixed migration.

- MMC central team provides ongoing quality assurance and capacity building to the regions - (continuous) - Development of two global MM reports further establish MMC as the leading source for high quality analysis on mixed migration - Publication of (cross-regional) 2 research studies/papers - Increasing number of visitors of the MMC website (up from 2,400 in the 1st month of the launch to 7,000 visitors per month) - Publication of 8 short articles on timely topics in mixed migration - Further development of the MMC as the go-to resource globally on mixed migration

target.value: - MMC central team provides ongoing quality assurance and capacity building to the regions - (continuous) - Development of two global MM reports further establish MMC as the leading source for high quality analysis on mixed migration - Publication of (cross-regional) 2 research studies/papers - Increasing number of visitors of the MMC website (up from 2.400 in the 1st month of the launch to 7.000 visitors per month) - Publication of 8 short articles on timely topics in mixed migration - Further development of the MMC as the go-to resource globally on mixed migration

title.narrative: Through its continued engagement in global and regional fora and debates on mixed migration the use of MMC data, research findings, analysis and policy messages and analysis on the implementation of the GCM, the MMC positively influences global and regional policy processes, leading to improved policy making around mixed migration globally and in the regions and better outcomes (e.g. protection) for migrants on the move

target.value: By continued engagement in a range of migration fora. the organisation of round tables. publication of policy papers on follow-up and implementation of the GCM. provision of high-quality data. research and analysis and further development of regional knowledge hubs. the MMC continues to build upon its global expertise. further develops a leading role and has become a well-known source for neutral and rational analysis and recommendations and contributions to global policy making on migration.
